pullRequest.title: Treatments in study view
pullRequest.bodyText:
This PR creates two new endpoints to support the new treatments
charts in the study view. It also adds additional logic to the
StudyViewFilterApplier to help it filter by treatment. The commit
also fixes two endpoints that 500ed when given a filter that results
in 0 samples.
/treatments/patient returns a list of PatientTreatmentRows. Each
patient treatment rows represents the number of patients that have
recieved a specific treatment.
/treatments/sample returns a list of SampleTreatmentRows. Each
sample treatment row represents either the number of samples
that were taken after a patient recieved a specific treatment,
or the number of samples that were taken before a patient recieved
a specific treatment.
The StudyViewFilter gained two new fields: sampleTreatmentFilters
and patientTreatmentFilters. These fileds correspond to the previously
described rows and filter out samples as you would expect.

nodes.bodyText: Maybe change to "Get all patient level treatments"
Better to add the same comment * @param sampleId sample.STABLE_ID as PatientTreatmentFilter.java
Is this necessary? Will you create more test cases for StudyViewFilterApplierTest?
Nice! We have lots of places are require non-empty study id list or non-empty sample/patient list, maybe we can do the same thing for those mapper methods.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -32,11 +32,16 @@
         INNER JOIN cancer_study ON sample_list.CANCER_STUDY_ID = cancer_study.CANCER_STUDY_ID
         INNER JOIN reference_genome ON cancer_study.REFERENCE_GENOME_ID = reference_genome.REFERENCE_GENOME_ID
         <if test="studyIds != null">
-			WHERE cancer_study.CANCER_STUDY_IDENTIFIER IN
-			<foreach item="item" collection="studyIds" open="("
-				separator="," close=")">
-				#{item}
-			</foreach>
+            <if test="studyIds.isEmpty()">
+                WHERE FALSE
+            </if>
+            <if test="!studyIds.isEmpty()">

nodes.bodyText: Any specific reason for including Sample in the name? If not, I would prefer just ClinicalEvent
Since it is a Map, any specific reason to sort?
Method name doesn't suggest anything about return type. May be rename it?
looks like samples are iterated 3 times, will there be any performance issue?
Looks like sorted list is not required at any place. this response is directly sent through api (I assume sorting will be done in front-end).
looks like all treatments can be fetched from treatmentsByPatient(line 139). would it be different invoking treatmentRepository.getAllUniqueTreatments?

shouldn't this be uniqueRows.get(rowToAdd.getTreatment() + rowToAdd.getTime().name()).add(rowToAdd);?
btw could you create a separate method for generating the key?

I think check for sample in TreatmentRow samples list might be an expensive operation(if there are many samples and/or if there are many treatments in selection). And there can be same sample id for multiple studies. I think you need to check for both sampleId and studyId together.
I propose to change replace sample and studies in both PatientTreatmentRow and SampleTreatmentRow to a Map<SampleIdentifier, Boolean> if not to a List -> to support duplicate sampleIds.
This goes same with SampleTreatmentFilter.java
